data.text:
Despite the threat of #COVID19, the women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world continue their vital work to protect the most vulnerable. 

Here is one example from @unamidnews. https://t.co/t0orW0dR6l

Measles cases around the world a 23-year high in 2019, according to new research from @WHO. 

Protect your community and your family by making sure your child's measles vaccines are up to date. https://t.co/fb2zSNT9Z1 #VaccinesWork https://t.co/gv1V9txz54

Alcohol kills millions of people every year and poses serious health risks, including:

- Liver damage 
- Cancer
- Heart disease
- Poor mental health

More facts from @WHO about the dangers of harmful drinking: https://t.co/Lrgu7uiTLg https://t.co/EL19cbXAcB

🍎 Only buy what you need
🍽 Plan meals ahead of time
❄️ Freeze leftovers

@WFP has more tips & tricks on how YOU can help prevent food waste. https://t.co/sXuAknL6kv #StopTheWaste https://t.co/nIgsBCMMA0

As people in the USA celebrate Thanksgiving, we can all show our gratitude to the essential workers & frontline heroes who are risking their well-being to serve their communities during #COVID19, from doctors & nurses to grocery store workers & truck drivers.

🎨: Vanessa Santos https://t.co/Ye7ZxtyPKG

Each year, more than 8 million tonnes of plastic end up in the ocean.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help protect our water resources by avoiding single-use plastics, taking shorter showers and turning off the tap when brushing your teeth, https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/znDtjZenmj

As people in the USA celebrate Thanksgiving, take a moment to support a child from a family that may be struggling with food insecurity.

See how you can help achieve #ZeroHunger with @WFP's Share The Meal app: https://t.co/q2ILhuVgif https://t.co/VJaEcZr1mn

As the world tackles #COVID19, @UNEP explains four guiding principles to reduce the risks of future pandemics originating from wild animals, while promoting the sustainable use of wildlife resources. 
https://t.co/EiC4mcRKiO

Nurses & midwives make up the largest group of healthcare workers in the world - and they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response. 

On Thursday's Thanksgiving Day & every day, let's show solidarity and #SupportNursesAndMidwives. https://t.co/1DVI8cegod https://t.co/rdAl3QfCE2

Security Council briefing on Syria highlights:

9.3 million people food insecure. 
6.7 million people internally displaced.
3+ million people need assistance through winter. 

https://t.co/dLoH37d0Kl

Violence against women & girls is a human rights violation that’s been perpetuated for decades.

It’s pervasive, but it’s not inevitable - unless we stay silent.

See how Wednesday's Int'l Day to End Violence against Women kicked off #16Days of Activism. 
https://t.co/4QrnjEHWNt

Every 100 seconds, a child or an adolescent was infected with HIV, last year. 

As #COVID19 exacerbates inequities in access to life-saving HIV services, @UNICEF calls on governments to protect, sustain & accelerate progress in fighting childhood HIV. https://t.co/YVMJ0N47kc

Conflict-related sexual violence is not only a human rights violation, but also a threat to international peace & security.

Supporting & uplifting survivors must continue, even during the #COVID19 pandemic. More from @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/OIJkszsLx7 #OrangeTheWorld https://t.co/vkdhA0nazJ

"You know that every single day is a day of somebody losing their lives, or their livelihoods. And so you say: no more time!"

-- @OSE_Yemen talks about the important work of humanitarians in the latest episode of our Awake At Night podcast: https://t.co/hCiL32z6zK https://t.co/OETCGHNbyd

"Violence against women and girls is a global human rights challenge. The #COVID19 pandemic has further exposed this issue as a global emergency requiring urgent action."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's Int'l Day to End Violence against Women. https://t.co/P1s1HFB923 #16days https://t.co/jj1yleLAbv

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.
❌ Don't share rumours
✔️ Choose content verified by reliable sources
https://t.co/71POIuF0v5

🎨: Ruth Borrows https://t.co/UNyaJxE2Ga

Women & girls have increasingly become the target of online violence & abuse amid #COVID19.

On Wednesday's Int'l Day to End Violence against Women, @UN_Women shares strategies to prevent & respond to online gender-based violence: https://t.co/pU8EV3RYDR #16days https://t.co/rrFYOs8B1U

Iraq: Continued international support essential as country addresses political, security & economic crises, as well as fallout from #COVID19 pandemic, head of @UNIraq tells Security Council. https://t.co/LEfxmz0KFV

1 in 3 women experience violence in their lifetime -- and amid #COVID19, domestic abuse has surged worldwide.

On Wednesday's Int'l Day to End Violence against Women, @UN_Women explains how YOU can take action: https://t.co/CW8xnoB3tN #16days https://t.co/w5lJFYQhkI

"Economic progress rests on halting the further spread of the pandemic. Vaccines, tests & treatments must be global public goods, available & affordable for all."
 
-- @antonioguterres on the rebirth of the global economy after #COVID19. 
https://t.co/5rGby2RJ9T

We can all do our part to beat #COVID19.

@WHO has 5 tips to help keep you & your loved ones safe: 

🙌 clean hands
😷 wear a mask
📏 stay distant
🤧 cover your cough & sneeze
🪟 open windows

https://t.co/w3s3KMGzbj https://t.co/ilRAHNUGXT

Taking #ClimateAction doesn't have to be difficult.

Use the new #ActNow @Instagram face filter to spread the word about how you are helping to protect the planet and build a more sustainable world: https://t.co/Dg1yMJP0MK https://t.co/YgVHiY9r5d

In recent weeks, thousands of refugees & migrants have arrived in Spain's Canary Islands from West African coasts, a dangerous route that has claimed at least 500 lives this year.

Reinforced cooperation & solidarity is needed to help the most vulnerable. https://t.co/4OR2OOjG9Q

#COVID19 is threatening the rights of millions of vulnerable workers, pushing them towards even greater insecurity.

@ILO says pandemic response measures must take into account workers rights to build an equitable world. https://t.co/25ivk1EjBL

A sustained ceasefire is the only way to achieve peace and prosperity in Afghanistan, top UN officials stress at international conference aimed at ending long-running conflict in the country. https://t.co/MMl8rdH6I9

The distribution of #COVID19 vaccines will be an unprecedented undertaking.

The UN is working with logistics organizations to create plans for the safe & timely delivery of nearly 2 billion doses once they are available.
 
https://t.co/2ffj9AcgJG

3 tips to prevent antimicrobial resistance:
👩‍⚕️ Seek medical advice when you are ill
💊 Only take antibiotics & other antimicrobials when prescribed
🤲 Wash your hands frequently to prevent infections 
 
More from @WHO during Antimicrobial Awareness Week: https://t.co/2uofsa01Be https://t.co/XQXxnwqZDX

The climate crisis has not stopped amid #COVID19.

The industrial slowdown due to the pandemic has not curbed the record levels of greenhouse gases which are driving the climate emergency. 

More details in new @WMO report: https://t.co/0GebJOi3OR https://t.co/zufToRLtEA

Millions of refugees have crossed borders to find safety.

Find out which countries have welcomed the most people and how our colleagues from @refugees are helping those forced to flee: https://t.co/NwK9aYZasS

https://t.co/Umh5GtrWMh

"I firmly believe that if we can get them to sit down opposite each other, they will agree that finally, we can start the road to peace."

-- @OSE_Yemen Martin Griffiths tells @MelissaFleming about his efforts to bring and end to hostilities in Yemen. https://t.co/hCiL32hvba https://t.co/qQ8LaPORBt

Since the creation of the UN, 80+ former colonies comprising 750 million people have gained independence.  

Learn more about decolonization: https://t.co/70Vjl8ed8E https://t.co/5yCqKymCYu

The @UNFCCC #ClimateDialogues are set to increase momentum for greater #ClimateAction and ambition in the run-up to next year's UN Climate Conference #COP26.

Details here: https://t.co/RKdyybOllw https://t.co/6gSB0zI1Cs

#VaccinesWork

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations.

Help share verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/eKZG9znr9P

Antibiotics are becoming less effective against common infections due to overuse & misuse.

Everyone has a role to play to stop the spread of drug-resistant infections. @FAO explains how 📽️ https://t.co/E9O0ZONNqM https://t.co/dcHB5mr2VV

Solidarity is survival amid #COVID19.

Find some inspiring examples of hope and kindness in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/XO2UbpsWVx
Do #COVID19 antibodies last? And what does that mean for a COVID vaccine? Harvard professor Galit Alter explains how #VaccinesWork. https://t.co/5eunWkHrlr https://t.co/i7ntSH7EOh

The UN Public Service Awards recognize initiatives that can help achieve the #GlobalGoals, including the promotion of inclusive & equitable services for all. 

Deadline for submissions is 24 November. More details here: https://t.co/anPrmg9bUh https://t.co/sNkEv5Rz12

Transforming food systems can help:

🍽️ Reach #ZeroHunger
🌳 Achieve the #GlobalGoals
🥗 Promote healthy diets
🐯 Reverse biodiversity loss
      & much more. 

@FoodSystems explains how ⤵️ 

https://t.co/IC5bs0KTx2

More than 13M people need urgent humanitarian aid in Burkina Faso, Mali & Niger amid violence, #COVID19 & extreme weather.

@UNOCHA shares some powerful stories of people living in one of the world’s fastest-growing emergencies. https://t.co/DaUjWliCzb

Violence in Ethiopia's Tigray region is causing a full-scale humanitarian crisis, with thousands fleeing into Sudan to seek safety.

The UN is on the ground, providing lifesaving assistance. https://t.co/dq4sOG81k1 via @UN_SDG https://t.co/9jJC0N9FJT

"We are still running behind in the race against time. 
Every country, city, financial institution and company should adopt plans for transitioning to net zero emissions by 2050."

-- @antonioguterres calls for urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/EBCH0M6wC1 https://t.co/MRHoFUUfhe

Lack of safe sanitation puts billions of people at risk of contracting infectious diseases around the world.

Here's the story of a woman's lifelong journey to bring toilets to remote villagers in Nepal, with support from the UN. https://t.co/mrCP4bnrdR via @UN_SDG https://t.co/GsFKOZu6qq

Every second, the equivalent of one garbage truck full of textiles is landfilled or burned, polluting our environment and adding harmful greenhouse gases. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero - mend, donate and keep clothing out of landfills! https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/c0brUXqePY

Saturday is #WorldTVDay! 📺

UN Video reports from all over the world, putting a human face on the key issues of our time. https://t.co/fR1enC7n7V https://t.co/3QbdJKNw2L

🐟🐡🐠 Sustainable fisheries help protect our marine environment, enhance food security and contribute to achieving the #GlobalGoals.

More from @FAO on Saturday's #WorldFisheriesDay: https://t.co/rT96w40YFv https://t.co/5r0RWdTvVq

📺 Television helps raise awareness about the important issues facing our communities & our planet.

Saturday is #WorldTVDay. https://t.co/czXOpoNmPx https://t.co/KSLfttWV7E

“Everyone should have hope. 
There is going to be a #COVID19 vaccine that protects us."

-- @Harvard Professor Shiv Pillai tells @MelissaFleming. 
Watch their full @Instagram Live conversation about vaccine development & combatting misinformation here: https://t.co/K7jywrfrGk https://t.co/oQyuLFs6LD

Our future depends on young people.

Check out our @TwitterMoments to see how we celebrated Friday's #WorldChildrensDay: https://t.co/T9TOYfbdLx

Fishing is considered one of the most dangerous occupations on Earth, with an estimated 32,000+ fatalities a year.

On Saturday's #WorldFisheriesDay, @FAO stresses the need to ensure fishers’ safety while sustainably managing the world’s aquatic resources. https://t.co/i97OZxbKG9 https://t.co/q1ufLJH80u

#COVID19 vaccines must be treated as a global public good - a people’s vaccine accessible and affordable to everyone, everywhere. 

-- @antonioguterres stresses that solidarity & universal access to treatment are the only ways to stop the pandemic. https://t.co/LhMVWTSUBW https://t.co/USeuSHMvRo

"Yemen is now in imminent danger of the worst famine the world has seen for decades."

-- @antonioguterres calls for urgent action to stave off catastrophe and save millions of lives in Yemen. https://t.co/k6gcqW34Wj

People from around the world have already logged more than 1 million of their #ClimateAction activities. 

Join the movement and download the app that helps you help save our planet. #ActNow! https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb https://t.co/PF8NbwAr7x

Every child has the right to a safe, healthy, peaceful childhood and to develop to their full potential.

On Friday's #WorldChildrensDay and every day, join us in speaking up for children's rights! https://t.co/kV2r2hzeL5 https://t.co/ihhBlusaFg

Industry is of critical importance for sustainable economic growth in Africa.

On Friday's Africa Industrialization Day, learn how industrial development helps contribute to poverty eradication through employment & wealth creation on the continent. https://t.co/PUfFLVGkLo https://t.co/8Na4UenMZr

Global coordination is urgently needed to prevent the #COVID19 crisis from becoming a child-rights crisis.

On Friday's #WorldChildrensDay, @UNICEF launches a plan with practical & concrete actions to avert a lost generation of children. https://t.co/QEmYbChCTF https://t.co/0DYvEOAAjc

#COVID19 has significantly impacted economic activity in Africa, pushing it into its first recession in 25 years.
 
On Friday's Africa Industrialization Day, learn more about how the pandemic has affected the continent's industries. https://t.co/QR7CoDlhXD https://t.co/8k3sxZpzJn

Hundreds of millions of students are currently affected by school closures due to #COVID19.

On Friday's #WorldChildrensDay, @UNICEF is urging countries to ensure all children can continue to learn. See how YOU can take action #ForEveryChild: https://t.co/SoPwPC4nah https://t.co/PETfCJq30R

“After many years of oppression, division, chaos, misery and conflict, Libyans are coming together for the sake of Libya, for the sake of their children and grandchildren.”

-- Stephanie Williams, head of @UNSMILibya tells Security Council. https://t.co/PmCgjmHWIi

1 in 9 #COVID19 cases worldwide has been among children & young people under 20.

On top of affecting their health, the pandemic threatens to cause irreversible harm to children’s education, nutrition & well-being, @UNICEF warns. https://t.co/sD39U1SnGC https://t.co/6zZwzQVZPi

Urgent investment in sanitation is needed to combat the spread of infectious diseases and to reduce the threat of antimicrobial resistance

Latest from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldToiletDay. https://t.co/Xdq3DvOvpO https://t.co/HD3B5fNX9O

"We are still running behind in the race against time. 
Every country, city, financial institution and company should adopt plans for transitioning to net zero emissions by 2050."

-- @antonioguterres calls for urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/EBCH0M6wC1 https://t.co/8BFm3KDIPm

Globally, 80% of wastewater flows back into the ecosystem without being treated or reused.

On Thursday's #WorldToiletDay, find out how sustainable sanitation systems can help tackle the climate crisis: https://t.co/ZweoGUko7M #ClimateAction https://t.co/pUggwxgVPL

Happy #InternationalMensDay to all the male allies around the world who support women, defy gender roles, fight gender-based violence & stand up for equality. 

@UN_Women invites everyone, everywhere, to support #GenerationEquality. https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/9ZrbYcMSN9

Thursday's #PhilosophyDay celebrates the importance of reflection and critical thinking for solving some of the greatest challenges facing humankind. 

Learn more: https://t.co/Z29qhan0Ue https://t.co/iXhoBVJ9My

Philosophy creates the intellectual conditions needed for peace and the achievement of the #GlobalGoals.

Thursday is World #PhilosophyDay: https://t.co/Z29qhaEBLM https://t.co/lBQxkNyxEd

The latest Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo has been defeated, partly thanks to a vaccination campaign to protect people at high risk. 

@WHO says the lessons learned will be invaluable in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/J7igxzj0EF

Everyone has the right to safe and hygienic sanitation services that provide privacy and ensure dignity.

On Thursday's #WorldToiletDay, learn how YOU can take action to help tackle the global sanitation crisis. https://t.co/ZweoGU2Nge https://t.co/e81trxsYwF

Do you have a favourite philosopher?

Thursday's #PhilosophyDay is an opportunity to highlight the role of critical thinking for building fairer & more inclusive societies, particularly during these challenging times. 

More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/VBYDTiSskH https://t.co/di367ZO5YS

Toilets, along with clean water & good hygiene, are essential for fighting #COVID19 and other diseases. Yet, billions of people around the world live without safe sanitation services.

 More on Thursday's #WorldToiletDay 🚽: https://t.co/3pjFvqV09s https://t.co/XqBec7KDgD

💉 Stockpiling syringes for the upcoming vaccine
🏥 Delivering oxygen 
🎓 Disinfecting universities

Find more examples of our work to tackle #COVID19 in one of our latest @TwitterMoments:  https://t.co/XDZ7PAUfYG

.@IMOHQ approves new #ClimateAction steps to cut ship emissions.

The draft regulations would require ships to combine a technical and an operational approach to reduce their carbon intensity. https://t.co/URpeL0IO89 https://t.co/rkxfQ7ggKL

Good health news: The 11th Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has been declared over, nearly six months after the first cases were reported.

@WHOAFRO supported the response efforts in Equateur Province. https://t.co/H7hlwQfqJh https://t.co/B9jCc5R3Gc

94,000+ peacekeepers are #ServingForPeace in 13 @UNpeacekeeping missions around the world to:

🔹 Maintain & restore peace & security
🔹 Help & protect communities
🔹 Promote human rights

& much more: https://t.co/BNza718hMZ 🕊️#A4P

https://t.co/1AQWqQgq3u

It's World Antimicrobial Awareness Week!

ALWAYS seek the advice of a qualified healthcare professional before taking antibiotics. 💊 We can all do our part to help stop the spread of drug-resistant infections. https://t.co/4JDQI9Ej1s https://t.co/7xxAzcvsGL

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable future for all. 

New maps & data from the @WorldBank show where we stand and what impact #COVID19 has had on the progress being made. https://t.co/BZduf2IiWP https://t.co/PAT86AJG9R

From medical supplies to school feeding programmes, the UN is providing vital support to the people of Sierra Leone amid the pandemic. 

Learn more about their work, including efforts underway to empower women & achieve gender equality. https://t.co/Gy15FAfsSi via @UN_SDG https://t.co/rpAt7Tpyrv

Improved governance & socioeconomic statistical systems can support sustainable peace & development in Africa, and contribute to achieving the #GlobalGoals.

More on Wednesday's African Statistics Day: https://t.co/tqQFzYRO9G https://t.co/nHnJOw1i3I

During her visit to Ghana, @AminaJMohammed met with young people living with HIV & disabilities, visited a UN-supported youth facility that helps reduce urban poverty & much more. https://t.co/mSdDABQqN0 https://t.co/qP6IekQhVU

#COVID19 can only end with vaccination. 

However, studies suggest that people who see vaccine misinformation are less likely to take the vaccine when it is available. 

Until all of us are safe, none of us are safe. https://t.co/OlRIUpe2vN #VaccinesWork https://t.co/kZ28t3gpgl

Cervical cancer is preventable & curable through:
🔸 Human Papillomavirus vaccination
🔸 Screening & care of precancerous lesions
🔸 Treatment 

@WHO launches global strategy for the elimination of cervical cancer: https://t.co/v670bsVzwt https://t.co/vHudvYKhwR

To help women enjoy a healthy pregnancy & reduce risks of preterm births, @WHO recommends:

🍎 Enjoying a healthy, nutritious diet
🚭 Avoiding tobacco & substance use
👩‍⚕️ Quality & respectful antenatal care

More on Tuesday's #WorldPrematurityDay: https://t.co/FxiKEAl0OW https://t.co/eRlqoBZRjQ

"We don't go to sleep if we haven't finished doing everything that we can to solve the problem, to rescue a person, to allow a refugee to have access to safety."

🎧 More from @Refugees Chief @FilippoGrandi about what inspires his work every day: https://t.co/v0J6m0Hak8 https://t.co/BZlqqBUYIS

Skin-to-skin contact & breastfeeding are an essential part of care for preterm babies.

New @WHO study shows that steroids can also boost survival of premature babies when given to pregnant women at risk of preterm birth. #WorldPrematurityDay

https://t.co/kyZBOqckEi

Biodiversity conservation can help address the climate crisis. 

A new @UNEP report looks at the synergies between climate and nature. #ClimateAction 
https://t.co/6fcHfhBI4z

Every year, 15 million babies are #BornTooSoon & more than 1 million die due to complications from being born prematurely.

On Tuesday's #WorldPrematurityDay, @WHO explains how those deaths can be prevented: https://t.co/FxiKEAl0OW https://t.co/zWJMbidWYh

New virtual exhibit showcases the hopes & dreams of children trapped in humanitarian crises.

The images highlight the crucial role of education for ensuring children's safety & a better future. https://t.co/fXrfvtGHgJ via @UNOCHA https://t.co/ZsRJDOcTnh

Tuesday is #WorldPrematurityDay.

While most preterm babies survive in high-income countries, in low- and middle-income countries a lack of adequate newborn care puts the lives of many babies at risk.

👉 Key facts from @WHO: https://t.co/FxiKEACCdw #BornTooSoon https://t.co/8YCxlFOB1s

Happy 75th birthday, @UNESCO!

Ever since the adoption of its constitution in November 1945, UNESCO has been working for peace through education, science, culture and communication. https://t.co/UDOU84VhDJ #UNESCO75 https://t.co/oRqFkoCrXt

"We are all part of a global response to a global crisis."

-- @AminaJMohammed following her visit to a UN #COVID19 clinic in Mali this weekend. https://t.co/pjSlAGVcRp https://t.co/uZY1XgAiv1

Inclusion and respect towards all people are essential for a more peaceful world. 

More on Monday’s #ToleranceDay: https://t.co/s3xHu41i4P #GlobalGoals https://t.co/tmaWIy9VGp

Millions of people, including women & children, are suffering from on-going conflict, even as #COVID19 grips the world.

Join @antonioguterres' call for a global ceasefire & show your support for a more peaceful world: https://t.co/WySRWXUIjy

https://t.co/Yuoh7PyvC9
Monday is #ToleranceDay - an opportunity to focus on solidarity, inclusion and helping those in need. https://t.co/r2uXH8IDnh https://t.co/0Jh1v4Xfy3

📷: “Do unto others as you would have them do unto you” - the "Golden Rule" mosaic based on a painting by US artist Norman Rockwell on display at UNHQ in NYC. 

Monday is #ToleranceDay: https://t.co/r2uXH90eeP https://t.co/oS0riCqDTE

The #ParisAgreement is an international treaty on the climate emergency which aims to limit global warming and help build resilience.

It offers a meaningful yet flexible framework for all countries to tackle the climate crisis together: https://t.co/2NtTTL0hq9 https://t.co/aj8Drxm2GJ
Practice tolerance & respect for diversity - values which bring people together and make us all stronger - on Monday's #ToleranceDay & every day. https://t.co/HU1ZOVMoge https://t.co/oHQnMBpqxH

Young people get a huge amount of their information online, where false and potentially harmful advice is prevalent.

Share these tips for talking to children about misinformation, including helping them tell fact from fiction.

#VaccinesWork

They help prevent millions of deaths every year & are continuously monitored to ensure they are safe & effective.

Social media & chat apps are increasingly being used to recruit trafficking victims amid the #COVID19 crisis.

@UNHumanRights committee calls for greater efforts to protect women & girls from trafficking during the pandemic. https://t.co/aFiEDx8jVr
